articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA, JACK JEFFERY and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israel said Tuesday that its troops had entered Gaza’s second-largest city as intensified bombardment sent streams of ambulances and cars racing to hospitals with wounded and dead Palestinians, including children, in a bloody new phase of the war.
articles.title: Israel moves into Gaza's second-largest city and intensifies strikes in bloody new phase of the war

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA, JACK JEFFERY and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israel said Tuesday that its troops had entered Gaza’s second-largest city as intensified bombardment sent streams of ambulances and cars racing to hospitals with wounded and dead Palestinians, including children, in a bloody new phase of the war.
articles.title: Israel moves into Gaza's second-largest city and intensifies strikes in bloody new phase of the war

articles.author: LORI HINNANT and SAM McNEIL
articles.description: NIR OZ, Israel (AP) — The engineer and his family cowered in the safe room, dark except for a red remote-control light because they feared the gunmen outside the door would notice anything brighter.
articles.title: 'We are officially hostages.' How the Israeli kibbutz of Nir Oz embodied Hamas hostage strategy

articles.author: ANNIE MA of The Associated Press and MEREDITH KOLODNER of The Hechinger Report
articles.description: SALISBURY, Md. (AP) — Three times a week, on average, a police car pulls up to a school in Wicomico County on Maryland’s Eastern Shore. A student is brought out, handcuffed and placed inside for transport to a hospital emergency room for a psychiatric evaluation.
articles.title: Handcuffed and sent to the ER – for misbehavior: Schools are sending more kids to the hospital

articles.author: SETH BORENSTEIN and SIBI ARASU
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — After days of shaving off the edges of key warming issues, climate negotiators Tuesday zeroed in on the tough job of dealing with the main cause of what's overheating the planet: fossil fuels.
articles.title: To phase out or phase down fossil fuels? That is the question at COP28 climate talks

articles.author: MATTHEW LEE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — In a rare punitive move against Israel, the State Department said Tuesday it will impose travel bans on extremist Jewish settlers implicated in a rash of recent attacks on Palestinians in the occupied West Bank.
articles.title: In a rare action against Israel, US says extremist West Bank settlers will be barred from America

articles.author: CHRIS MEGERIAN and LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris broke a nearly 200-year-old record for casting the most tiebreaking votes in the Senate when she voted Tuesday to confirm a new federal judge in Washington, D.C.
articles.title: Vice President Harris breaks nearly 200-year-old record for Senate tiebreaker votes, casts her 32nd

articles.author: MARK SHERMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court on Tuesday seemed inclined to uphold a tax on foreign income while leaving questions about a broader, never-enacted tax on wealth for another day.
articles.title: Supreme Court signals it will uphold a tax on foreign income and leave a wealth tax for another day

articles.author: MICHAEL REZENDES and JASON DEAREN
articles.description: HAILEY, Idaho (AP) — Paul Rytting listened as a woman, voice quavering, told him her story. When she was a child, her father, a former bishop in The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, had routinely slipped into bed with her while he was aroused, she said.
articles.title: Recordings show how the Mormon church protects itself from child sex abuse claims

articles.author: MARDI ROSA TANJUNG
articles.description: BATU PALANO, Indonesia (AP) — Rescuers searching the hazardous slopes of Indonesia's Mount Marapi volcano found 11 more bodies of climbers who were caught by a surprise weekend eruption, raising the number of confirmed dead to 22, officials said Tuesday.
articles.title: More bodies found after sudden eruption of Indonesia's Mount Marapi, raising confirmed toll to 22
